dt.t: The biochemical barrage, which would be helpful were it directed at a foreign invader, provokes sustained inflammation of the airway lining. And, perversely, it makes the tissue much more sensitive (or {wi}hyperresponsive{/wi}) to the original trigger.

Studies … have shown a {wi}hyperresponsive{/wi} amygdala and impaired inhibition from the prefrontal cortex during tasks involving exposure to facial expressions, reactions to emotionally charged words, and interpersonal cooperation.

utxt.t: Measurements of airway {wi}hyperresponsiveness{/wi}, although not sufficiently sensitive or specific to provide a definite diagnosis of asthma, are closely correlated with clinical assessments of the presence and severity of the disease.

shortdef: characterized by an abnormal degree of responsiveness (as to a physical or emotional stimulus)
